alert.note: Alert for Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued April 21 at 3:18AM EDT until April 22 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...East winds 20 mph and gusty will produce rough surf. A Moderate risk of life-threatening rip currents will also exist. * WHERE...The beaches of Brevard county. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can knock you off your feet and make you even more susceptible to being caught in the seaward pull of a rip current.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Mainland Northern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard
